name: Assault Rifle
description: A reliable, rapid-fire weapon favored by soldiers and raiders alike for its balanced accuracy and fire rate.

name: Blunderbuss
description: A wide-mouthed scatter weapon that blasts anything unlucky enough to be nearby. Devastating up close, useless at range.

name: Bolt-Action Rifle
description: A precise, single-shot weapon with a slow cycle but deadly accuracy. Favored by hunters and sharpshooters.

name: Derringer
description: A tiny two-shot pistol easily hidden in a sleeve or boot. Last resort, first surprise.

name: Flamethrower
description: A volatile tank-fed weapon that spews fire in arcs, lighting up trenches, hallways, or crowds with searing heat.

name: Flapper's Purse Pistol
description: A sleek, stylish mini-pistol designed for high society—compact enough for a clutch, deadly enough for a threat.

name: Flintlock Pistol
description: Antique and unpredictable, but still dangerous. Used more for intimidation than sustained combat.

name: Grapple Gun
description: A specialized tool that fires a tethered hook, used for scaling buildings or snagging enemies with surprise.

name: Gut Shredder LMG
description: A belt-fed heavy machine gun that rips through flesh and armor alike. Brutal, loud, and hard to stop once it starts.

name: Lever-Action Rifle
description: A classic frontier rifle with a quick reload and satisfying cycle. Smooth handling, ideal for mid-range duels.

name: Machine Gun
description: A mounted or heavy-supported automatic weapon designed to suppress and overwhelm with sheer volume of fire.

name: Pen Gun
description: Disguised as a writing implement, this one-shot pistol is the weapon of choice for spies and desperate gamblers.

name: Pistol
description: Standard sidearm, widely available. Compact and balanced, reliable in most close-quarter situations.

name: Railway Rifle
description: A jury-rigged gun that fires railway spikes at high velocity, often with explosive results. Noisy, crude, deadly.

name: Revolver
description: Six shots of trust and iron. Slow to reload, fast to earn respect. Every shot counts.

name: Rifle
description: A general term for long-barreled firearms with solid range and stopping power. Standard issue for militias.

name: Semi-Automatic Pistol
description: Faster than a revolver, lighter than a rifle. Fires as fast as you pull the trigger—clean, fast, and modern.

name: Shotgun
description: Devastating in close quarters, scattering lead in a cone. Useless from afar, king of hallways and alleys.

name: Sniper Rifle
description: Built for distance and precision, this scoped weapon can end a fight before it starts.

name: Submachine Gun
description: A compact automatic weapon built for close-quarters firepower. Easy to control, easy to conceal.

name: Tommy Gun
description: Tommy Gun – Iconic drum-fed submachine gun of gangsters and trench raiders. Unloads bullets as fast as it chews through loyalty.

name: Umbrella Gun
description: A concealed firearm hidden in a reinforced umbrella, perfect for assassins in polite company.

name: Arcane Staff
featureEffect: Gain +1 Spell points. When you cast arcane spells deal an additional +2 damage
description: A long, ornate staff used to channel potent magical energies with precision and flair.

name: Basic Magic Staff
featureEffect: Gain +1 Spell points. You have +1 to the check while casting basic spells
description: A simple wooden staff that amplifies spells and helps maintain focus.

name: Crystal Wand
featureEffect: Gain +1 Spell points. When a creature casts a spell on you gain +1 spell points
description: A finely cut magical conduit used to direct and shape arcane power in delicate forms.

name: Gravedigger's Shovel
featureEffect: Deal an additional 3 damage to Eclipse creatures
description: A heavy iron shovel, often sharpened and repurposed as a brutal, symbolic weapon.

name: Psi Blade
description: A shimmering blade of thought and force, summoned by will and deadly to both body and mind.

name: Soul Jar Mace
description: A heavy mace with a crystal core that glows faintly, rumored to trap fragments of the souls it strikes.

name: Battle Axe
description: A two-handed axe built for cleaving armor and splitting foes in brutal fashion.

name: Blackjack Sap
description: A weighted leather club used to knock targets unconscious with silent efficiency.

name: Brass Knuckles
description: Small metal grips worn over the fingers to turn a punch into a bone-breaking impact.

name: Broadsword
description: A wide-bladed sword designed for powerful, sweeping strikes and battlefield dominance.

name: Cane Sword
description: A concealed blade hidden within a gentleman’s cane, perfect for stylish duels and surprise attacks.

name: Cattle Prod
description: An electrified rod used to shock targets into submission, common among slavers and enforcers.

name: Chain Whip
description: A flexible metal whip with barbed links, useful for entangling and tearing through light armor.

name: Claymore
description: A massive two-handed sword favored by berserkers and knights alike for overwhelming offense.

name: Club
description: A simple, blunt weapon used to bash, break, or bruise—often improvised, always effective.

name: Pirate Hook
description: A wicked prosthetic with sharp edges, useful for slashing or catching a foe off guard.

name: Dagger
description: A short blade suited for quick strikes, close quarters, and silent kills.

name: Deckblade
description: A curved sailor’s knife designed for cutting ropes, gutting fish, or defending in a pinch.

name: Dual Daggers
description: A matched pair of light blades meant for fast, fluid combat with relentless motion.

name: Dueling Sabre
description: A slender, fast blade designed for precision strikes and elegant duels.

name: Falchion
description: A curved, heavy-bladed sword built for slashing through armor and bone.

name: Fang Dagger
description: A jagged dagger shaped like a beast’s tooth, crafted to tear more than pierce.

name: Fist Weapon
description: A brutal close-combat weapon worn over the knuckles or as reinforced gloves.

name: Flail
description: A spiked head on a chain, swinging with chaotic force to crush and disorient.

name: Gangster's Cudgel
description: A weighted club favored by enforcers and thugs for its street-level intimidation.

name: Gladius
description: A short Roman-style blade perfect for stabbing in tight quarters or shield formations.

name: Glaive
description: A polearm with a long blade at the end, ideal for sweeping arcs and extended reach.

name: Great Club
description: An oversized wooden club used to smash enemies and break through obstacles.

name: Great Pick
description: A massive mining tool turned weapon, used to pierce armor and shatter defenses.

name: Great Sword
description: A massive two-handed sword with devastating reach and cutting power.

name: Greataxe
description: A heavy axe designed for wide sweeps and brutal cleaving strikes.

name: Halberd
description: A multi-functional polearm with axe, spear, and hook elements combined.

name: Handaxe
description: A compact throwing or chopping axe, ideal for one hand or dual wielding.

name: Heavy Axe
description: A large chopping axe meant for brute strength and intimidation.

name: Heavy Quarterstaff
description: A thick, reinforced staff used with two hands to batter and block.

name: Heavy Spear
description: A long spear with a weighted shaft, ideal for heavy thrusts and line-breaking charges.

name: Heavy Staff
description: A dense, arcane-carved staff used to strike with surprising force.

name: Heavy Whip
description: A long, barbed whip that delivers heavy tearing blows rather than finesse strikes.

name: Heel Knife
description: A concealed blade fitted in a shoe heel, designed for hidden stabs at close range.

name: Hookblade
featureEffect: When you hit with a success+ you can choose to grapple the target instead of rolling on the success table
description: A curved blade with a hooked end, ideal for pulling or disarming enemies.

name: Ice Pick
description: A narrow, pointed tool used to puncture with precision, often aimed at vital spots.

name: Javelin
description: A balanced throwing spear used for ranged attacks or quick stabs in close combat.

name: Katana
description: A curved, single-edged sword known for its swift, clean strikes and cutting power.

name: Knuckle Dusters
description: Reinforced rings or metal grips worn on the fists to maximize striking force.

name: Kukri
description: A heavy, inward-curving knife used for chopping and close-quarter slashing.

name: Lance
description: A long weapon designed for mounted charges, with devastating force behind its point.

name: Lantern Mace
description: A mace combined with a lantern, used to blind or bash in low-light conditions.

name: Light Hammer
description: A small hammer ideal for throwing or delivering quick, focused strikes.

name: Light Whip
description: A light, flexible whip used for snapping attacks and keeping enemies at bay.

name: Long Flail
description: An extended flail with a long chain and spiked head for wide, swinging blows.

name: Longsword
description: A balanced, double-edged sword made for versatility in offense and defense.

name: Mace
description: A blunt weapon with a heavy head, used to crush armor and break bones.

name: Machete
description: A heavy blade built for chopping through brush or foes with equal ease.

name: Maul
description: A massive, two-handed hammer that delivers staggering force on impact.

name: Morningstar
description: A spiked ball mounted on a shaft, mixing blunt trauma with piercing pain.

name: Naval Cutlass
description: A short, curved sword used by sailors, built for close-quarters combat.

name: Net
featureEffect: Target must make an Agility check or take the constrained condition until the end of their next turn
description: A mesh weapon thrown to entangle and restrict enemies from moving or escaping.

name: Nunchaku
description: Twin sticks connected by a chain, used in rapid succession to strike and deflect.

name: Pick
description: A small mining tool repurposed as a weapon to pierce and pry.

name: Pike
description: A long spear with reach, designed to keep enemies at bay and deliver heavy thrusts.

name: Police Baton
description: A simple, sturdy baton carried by officers for subduing suspects without killing.

name: Quarterstaff
description: A staff of equal ends used for defense, balance, and sweeping strikes.

name: Rapier
description: A slender sword built for thrusting with speed and precision.

name: Razor Blade
description: A thin, sharpened blade used for close-up slashes, easy to conceal.

name: Sabre
description: A curved sword with a single edge, used for quick, powerful cuts.

name: Sai
description: A three-pronged weapon used to trap and redirect enemy attacks.

name: Sapper's Shovel
featureEffect: Use the small shovel as a shield against fire, reducing fire damage by half as an off-action
description: A rugged entrenching tool adapted for brutal combat in close quarters.

name: Saw Blade Gauntlet
description: A forearm-mounted weapon with jagged teeth, designed to rip and block.

name: Scalpel
description: A surgical blade used for fine, precise cuts, often repurposed for silent kills.

name: Scimitar
description: A curved blade made for slashing with sweeping strikes, often ornate in design.

name: Shiv
description: A crude, improvised stabbing tool used in prisons or by desperate hands.

name: Shortsword
description: A compact, double-edged blade ideal for quick strikes and tight quarters.

name: Sickle
description: A curved farming blade turned weapon, used to hook and slash with ease.

name: Spear
description: A long polearm with a pointed tip, perfect for thrusting and keeping distance.

name: Stiletto
description: A narrow-bladed dagger designed for piercing gaps in armor with minimal effort.

name: Switchblade
description: A folding knife with a spring-loaded blade, quick to deploy in a pinch.

name: Throwing Axe
description: A small, hand-held axe designed for throwing or close combat.

name: Throwing Knife
description: A balanced blade crafted for precision throws and silent takedowns.

name: Trick Cane
description: A concealed weapon hidden inside a cane, often used by spies or duelists.

name: Trident
description: A three-pronged spear designed for catching, piercing, and pinning foes.

name: Truncheon
description: A solid baton used to subdue with blunt force, often used by guards and officers.

name: War Pick
description: A reinforced pick weapon designed to punch through armor with brute force.

name: War Scythe
description: A long, curved blade mounted on a staff, combining scythe reach with martial strength.

name: Warhammer
description: A two-handed hammer built for smashing shields, armor, and bones.

name: Whip
description: A flexible weapon used to lash, trip, or disarm opponents from a distance.

name: Blowgun
description: A stealthy weapon that fires small darts using breath, often tipped with poison.

name: Bolas
description: A pair of weighted cords designed to entangle a target’s legs mid-flight.

name: Boomerang
description: A curved, flat weapon that returns when thrown with skill—useful for distraction or strike.

name: Composite Bow
description: A powerful bow made from layered materials for added tension and range.

name: Crossbow
description: A mechanical bow that fires bolts with high accuracy and reload effort.

name: Crossbow, Heavy
description: A larger version of the crossbow, requiring strength or bracing to operate effectively.

name: Crossbow, Light
description: A lighter crossbow suited for quick shots and easier handling.

name: Dart
description: A small, easily concealed projectile thrown by hand for speed and surprise.

name: Harpoon
description: A barbed spear attached to a line, used to impale and retrieve targets.

name: Longbow
description: A tall, strongbow with exceptional range, favored by skilled archers.

name: Netcaster
description: A launcher designed to fire weighted nets for capturing or disabling foes.

name: Siege Crossbow
description: A mounted, crank-loaded crossbow capable of piercing armor at extreme range.

name: Sling
description: A simple weapon that hurls small stones or bullets, used for speed over power.
